content.full_text: Check of Abraham Lincoln to Joel A. Matteson, 28 August 18571 Springfield Marine & Fire Insurance Company, Richards & Smith, Printers. Pay toJ. A. Mattesonor BearerTwo hundred/100Dollars, IN CURRENT BANK NOTES.
paragraphs: Check of Abraham Lincoln to Joel A. Matteson, 28 August 18571
Pay toJ. A. Mattesonor BearerTwo hundred/100Dollars,
citations: Lawrence B. Stringer,History of Logan County Illinois(Chicago: Pioneer, 1911), 1:222; Harry E. Pratt,The Personal Finances of Abraham Lincoln(Springfield, IL: Abraham Lincoln Association, 1943), 67.

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln filled in the blanks of this partially printed check and signed it.

2It is unknown what this payment from Lincoln to Joel A. Matteson was for, but it was
                  likely related to aloanMatteson made toJames Primmthat was secured by Lincoln. When Primm could not pay back Matteson, Lincoln stepped
                  in and paid the debt, becoming the loaner to Primm. Primm repaid Lincoln in the form of real estate inLincoln, Illinois, on March 11, 1858.Lawrence B. Stringer,History of Logan County Illinois(Chicago: Pioneer, 1911), 1:222; Harry E. Pratt,The Personal Finances of Abraham Lincoln(Springfield, IL: Abraham Lincoln Association, 1943), 67.
